comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: R. B. (Raymond Belcher) Ward, Class of 1917, played Left Tackle (Number 8) for Brown University football, in this game against Cornell University, October 24, 1914 at the Polo Grounds (Brush Stadium) in New York. Ward suffered a broken collar bone during the game. Cornell trounced defeated Brown 28-7. With the outbreak of World War I, Ward enlisted in the Army as a Lieutenant at Camp Devens, and deployed with Batt. C in France. — [1] [2] [3] [4]

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Pixel Wrangler: We will add Ward's fuller name and the date and location of this game to the image description. Thank you!
